ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Occasional asynchronous class to take an exam or watch an Italian film.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: A great amount of Italian - past (both forms) and present. Useful vocabulary.
I learned fundamentals of speaking and writing Italian.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Fantastically organized for quick development of the language. I feel like better weighting of different skills (some things take longer to learn than others) could be helpful, but at this point I'm just picking out tiny details. One of the strongest courses at Yale.
I thought this course was incredible. Honestly, I cant think of any weaknesses.

Strengths: Very thorough, a lot of vocab and grammar learned and learned well. Exams were representative of our learning and the Professor (Farina) gave us very clear feedback and a lot of help to hone our skills. Very charismatic Professor, made the course so interesting. I especially enjoyed the lessons on culture (film, holidays, food, etc) because it gave me a real taste of the country. No weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought the virtual discussion format worked well for this course.

Loved the asynchronous testing; this worked well for me because I was a remote student and thus had to deal with a time difference for every class. Professor Farina was very accommodating. 
I felt the zoom format for classes/discussions/break out rooms was immensely effective. Very well facilitated, felt like any normal class.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes -- take the class. Both for fun or for a language requirement, this is a top pick amongst the language departments.
Absolutely. Michael is incredible, and this is an extremely rewarding course.
I would recommend this course specifically because of Michael Farina. His ability to create a welcoming environment and a safe learning space made the class amazing.

Yes. Its given me a vast introduction into the language and made me even more excited to continue my learning in the department. It has enriched me and challenged me, thus facilitating my growth throughout the semester.
